ResourceHeader.Description:
Hawk's Nest Radio Astronomy Observatory is a participant in the RadioJOVE project providing observations of radio emissions from Jupiter, the Sun, and the Galactic Background to other members of the RadioJOVE community. The observatory consists of an LWA (Long Wavelength Array) antenna, a TFD (Terminated Folded Dipole) array, a JOVE dipole array, and a Mosely 20 MHz Yagi.
The JOVE I receiver is fed the output from the TFD array, the JOVE II receiver the JOVE dipole array, the FSX 8S 12-bit switching dual polarization spectrograph receives the TFD array, the FSX 2 10-bit single polarization spectrograph receives the LWA array, and the SDRPlay RSP2 Software Defined Radio receives the TFD array.

InformationURL.Name: RadioJOVE Spectrograph Users Group (SUG)
InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the RadioJOVE project

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: HNRAO Dual Dipole Array and RadioJOVE receiver system
ResourceHeader.Description:
RadioJOVE Dual Dipole Array and RadioJOVE receiver system at the Hawk's Nest Radio Astronomy Observatory. This is a 2 element array separated by 20 feet. Each antenna element is 25 feet long. Polarization is linear. The array is aligned to magnetic north. The RadioJOVE direct conversion receiver has a 7 KHz RF bandwidth and operates at 20.1 MHz .
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

InformationURL.Name: RadioJOVE Spectrograph Users Group
InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the RadioJOVE project.

Instrument.InvestigationName: RadioJOVE phased Dual Dipole Array and RadioJOVE receiver system at HNRAO

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: HNRAO Terminated Folded Dipole and FSX-8S spectrograph system
ResourceHeader.Description:
Terminated Folded Dipole and FSX-8S 12 bit switching dual polarization spectrograph system at the Hawk's Nest Radio Astronomy Observatory. The TFD is a 4 element (26 foot) square array. Each antenna element is 24 feet long. Bandwidth is 30 kHz. Polarization is simulataneous RCP and LCP. TFD array is aligned to true north. The FSX-8S spectrograph operates at 15 -30 MHz simultaneous RCP and LCP.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

InformationURL.Name: Radio JOVE Spectrograph Users Group
InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the Radio JOVE project.

Instrument.InvestigationName: Terminated Folded Dipole and FSX-8S spectrograph at HNRAO

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: HNRAO Long Wavelength Array element and FSX-2 spectrograph system
ResourceHeader.Description:
Long Wavelength Array 4 phase crossed dipoles and FSX-2 10 bit single polarization spectrograph system at the Hawk's Nest Radio Astronomy Observatory. The HNRAO LWA is a 4 element square array of crossed dipoles 22 feet apart. Bandwidth is 15-30 MHz. Polarization is selectable RCP or LCP.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

InformationURL.Name: RadioJOVE Spectrograph Users Group
InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the RadioJOVE project.

Instrument.InvestigationName: Long Wavelength Array and FSX-2 spectrograph at HNRAO

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: HNRAO Terminated Folded Dipole and RadioJOVE receiver system
ResourceHeader.Description:
Terminated Folded Dipole and RadioJOVE receiver system at the Hawk's Nest Radio Astronomy Observatory. This is a 4 element (26 foot) square array. Each antenna element is 24 feet long. Bandwidth is 15-30 MHz. Polarization is simulataneous RCP and LCP. TFD array is aligned to true north. The RadioJOVE direct conversion receiver has a 7 KHz RF bandwidth and operates at 20.1 MHz .
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

InformationURL.Name: RadioJOVE Spectrograph Users Group
InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the RadioJOVE project.

Instrument.InvestigationName: Terminated Folded Dipole and RadioJOVE receiver system at HNRAO

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: HNRAO Terminated Folded Dipole and SDRPlay spectrograph system
ResourceHeader.Description:
Terminated Folded Dipole and SDRPlay Software Defined Radio spectrograph system at the Hawk's Nest Radio Astronomy Observatory. The TFD is a 4 element (26 foot) square array. Each antenna element is 24 feet long. Bandwidth is 15-30 MHz. Polarization is simulataneous RCP and LCP. TFD array is aligned to true north. The SDRPlay can be selected to detect either RCP or LCP.
See the Information URL for a link to a document providing additional descriptions of the instrument characteristics.

InformationURL.Name: RadioJOVE Spectrograph Users Group
InformationURL.Description: This site provide station diagrams and other reports for the receiver systems at several radio observatories associated with the RadioJOVE project.

Instrument.InvestigationName: Terminated Folded Dipole and SDRPlay spectrograph at HNRAO
